attribute-metadata.title: Number of benchmark rounds
attribute-metadata.label: Benchmark rounds
attribute-metadata.description: Typically, around 20-30 rounds is enough to get a good estimate of the average clustering time. Benchmarking is performed at regular priority and any processes running in the background may distort the result.

attribute-metadata.title: Number of warm-up rounds
attribute-metadata.label: Warmup rounds
attribute-metadata.description: Java virtual machine's JIT (just in time) compilation heavily affects execution speed. A few warm-up cycles are advised to eliminate initial noisy results.

attribute-metadata.title: Execution priority for benchmark threads
attribute-metadata.label: Thread priority
attribute-metadata.description: Setting high thread priority may block the user interface, but will give more accurate result. Low thread priority may cause distortions due to other system processes running in the background.

attribute-metadata.title: The number of concurrently executing benchmark threads
attribute-metadata.label: Number of concurrent threads
attribute-metadata.description: For multi-core processor, this setting can be used to saturate the CPU.

attribute-metadata.title: Directory where benchmark logs should be saved
attribute-metadata.label: Log directory
attribute-metadata.description: Plain-text benchmark logs are saved in the provided directory.

attribute-metadata.title: Opens the textual benchmark log in the Workbench's editor on end (only works if benchmark logging is enabled)
attribute-metadata.label: Open log in editor
